page.title: 13LOCAL CUSTOMS - GOLDSITHNEY
page.content: {FEAST DAYS} THE CELEBRATION OF THE SAINTS DAYS,OR FEASTS AS THEY ARE KNOWN, IS A TRADITION IN CORNWALL. ST.HILARY AND ST.PIRAN FEASTS ARE HELD EVERY YEAR - ST.HILARY FEAST ON 13TH.JANUARY, ST. PIRAN FEAST ON 5TH.MARCH. THE WESTERN HUNT TAKES TO THE FIELDS ON THESE DAYS AND THE PUBS DO A ROARING TRADE. THE OCCASION IS ALSO CELEBRATED IN THE CHURCHES. {CHARTER FAIR} THE GOLDSITHNEY CHARTER FAIR IS HELD ON THE FIRST SATURDAY IN AUGUST, ALTHOUGH THE CHARTER DAY IS AUG.5TH.. THE ORIGINS OF THE FAIR DATE BACK TO THE NORMAN ERA WHEN IT WAS THE OCCASION FOR PAYING TAXES. IT IS MENTIONED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK. A GAUNTLET IS DISPLAYED OUTSIDE THE TREVELYAN ARMS ON CHARTER FAIR DAY.
